moves.1. d4: In this game I will continue to use the d4 opening which has proven to be effective against most players here on GK, I want to thank eesther for the challenge, as he is undefeated to everyone here besides myself.
moves.1... d5: d5 is a solid move for center control
moves.2. c4: This is a book move and is made most of the time, depending on how black plays, Nf3 was considered also.
moves.3. Nf3: Now I play the other move now, Nc3 was also a move I liked more than c5.
moves.4. Nc3: my second N is developed to Nc3
moves.4... a6: a6 is played by black, I thought developing another minor piece would have been better, But He had a reason for this move I am sure.
moves.5. e3: I play e3 protecting my d4 pawn and opening way for my lsb to be developed.
moves.5... b5: b5 played protected by pawn on a6 and c6. This also allows Black to develop his pieces on his Q side.
moves.6. c5: I now advance pawn  to c5 and have a fine wall of connected pawns. My other thought was to get castled quickly by developing my lsb.
moves.6... Nbd7: develops his N in front of his Q. I thought he might of played Bg4 here.
moves.7. b4: I add another protector to my c5 pawn.
moves.7... a5: a5 is played which attacks pawn on b4
moves.8. bxa5: I decide to take here thinking to take is a mistake. By taking here I actually shift tempo to his favor I believe.
moves.8... Qxa5: Q takes pawn  and I wonder how I can defend this move. he took this move over taking with his rook, which could have been played and not getting his Q out early. The Q takes seems to be best.
moves.9. Bb2: this simple move does the job to protect the loss of my R if I had left his attack of a skewer not stopped.
moves.9... e5: e5 is played attacking the center.
moves.10. Be2: lsb is developed and now gives me a way to castle if I decide too. Right now I question if this is best place for my piece. My N is pinned and Bfd3 was my other move I had to choose from
moves.10... Ne4: I believe I said nice move after Ne4 was played. thinking I should have had my lsb on d3 here to take his N.
moves.11. Qc2: Q moved  Qc2  I had thought about castling 0-0 here.
moves.11... b4: b4 is advanced attacking my Nc3
moves.12... b3+: b3+  discovered checks and attacks my Q.
moves.13. Qd2: I offer Q exchange, Qc3 was also considered.
moves.13... dxe4: dxe4  was played taking back N.
moves.14. Ng5: I moved my N from attack Bg5
moves.15. Qxa5: Ok I finally take his Q off the board  Qxa5
moves.16. axb3: Why not axb3 offering exchange of Rooks
moves.18. b4: I decide to protect my c5 pawn by advancing b3 to b4.
moves.20. Bh5+: Now I get to attack! Bh5+ I down in score -1 but my pieces are developed especially my R.
moves.21... Rg8: Rg8 expected forced move or it is taken.
moves.23... Rh8: R moves back, tempo is in my favor.
moves.24. Nxc8: Why not I think trade a N for B.
moves.27... Nxc5: N takes pawn attacking my lsb.
moves.28. Bxg7: dsb takes pawn attacks his R.
moves.29. Bxf5: I have to retreat my lsb.
moves.32. Ke3: K used as an attacked moves of check
